text: 'the lamp next to the red curtains.'
program:
# define variables for the lamp and curtain
LAMP_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["lamp", "light"])
CURTAIN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["curtain", "shower curtain"])

# add a constraint: the curtain is red
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CURTAIN_0, condition="red")

# add a constraint: the lamp is next to the red curtain
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=LAMP_0, anchor=CURTAIN_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(LAMP_0)

text: 'the lamp that is not next to the pink dollhouse.'
program:
# define the lamp variable, which is the target
LAMP_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["lamp"])

# define the dollhouse variable as negative, since the lamp variable is the target and we want to locate it
DOLLHOUSE_NEG_0 = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["dollhouse"])

# constraint: the dollhouse is pink
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=DOLLHOUSE_NEG_0, condition="pink")

# the lamp is not next to the pink dollhouse
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=LAMP_0, anchor=DOLLHOUSE_NEG_0)

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(LAMP_0)

text: the pillow is buried under another white pillow and has a step stool nearby
program:

PILLOW_WHITE = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["pillow"])
STOOL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["stool"])

# add a constraint: the pillow is under another white pillow
CONSTRAINT_UNDER(target=PILLOW_0, anchor=PILLOW_WHITE)
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=PILLOW_WHITE, condition="white")

# add a constraint: has a step stool nearby
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=PILLOW_0, anchor=STOOL_0)

# finally set the CSP variable representing the target object
SET_TARGET(PILLOW_0)

BOOK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["book"])

text: the top white box on the floor
program:
# define variables for the box and the floor
BOX_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["box"])
FLOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["floor"])

# add a constraint: the box is on the floor
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=BOX_0, anchor=FLOOR_0)

# add a constraint: the box is white
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=BOX_0, condition="white")

# constraint: the box should be on the top, which means the highest position along z axis
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=BOX_0, score_func="position-z")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(BOX_0)

text: looking at the couches head on choose the last on the right that is directly behind the red ottoman.
program:
# define variables for the couch and ottoman
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])
OTTOMAN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["ottoman"])

# add a constraint: the ottoman is red
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=OTTOMAN_0, condition="red")

# the couch is behind the ottoman
CONSTRAINT_BEHIND(target=COUCH_0, anchor=OTTOMAN_0)

# The last on the right implies that the couch is the one that is farthest to the right
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=COUCH_0, score_func="right")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(COUCH_0)

text: the tiny portion of the couch with a red ottoman and table next to it
program:

OTTOMAN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["ottoman"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: the ottoman is red
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=OTTOMAN_0, condition="red")

# add a constraint: the ottoman and the table are next to the couch
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=OTTOMAN_0, anchor=COUCH_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=TABLE_0, anchor=COUCH_0)

# add a constraint: the couch is tiny (smallest)
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=COUCH_0, score_func="size")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(COUCH_0)

text: the small blue couch that is on the end.
program:
# define variable for the couch
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])

# add a constraint: the couch is blue
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=COUCH_0, condition="blue")

# add a constraint: the couch is the smallest
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=COUCH_0, score_func="size")

# add a constraint: the couch is at the end. Since "end" is not relative to another object, 
# it is considered at the side of the room and thus far from the room center.
ROOM_CENTER = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])
CONSTRAINT_FAR(target=COUCH_0, anchor=ROOM_CENTER)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(COUCH_0)

text: the blackish pillow under another blue pillow

# define a variable for the target pillow

# define a variable for the other pillow
PILLOW_BLUE = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["pillow"])

# add a constraint: the target pillow is blackish
# blackish is not a color included in CSS3, so the corresponding constraint should either not be used or replaced with a valid color name.
# In this case, we will replace it with the similar color "black".
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=PILLOW_BLACKISH, condition="black")

# add a constraint: the target pillow is under another pillow
CONSTRAINT_UNDER(target=PILLOW_BLACKISH, anchor=PILLOW_BLUE)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(PILLOW_BLACKISH)

PILLOW_BLUE = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["pillow"])

text: middle part of couch, seams end in between the 2 beige cocktail tables
program:
#The query mentions "cocktail tables" and "couch".
#The relevant object label contains "table" instead of "cocktail tables"
#The query mentions the middle part of the couch which might be hard to define
#Therefore, the approach is to find the couch, then determine that seams end in between the tables.

# define variables for the couch and tables
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])
TABLE_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])
TABLE_2 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# the seams of the couch ends in between the two tables, which means the couch is between two tables
CONSTRAINT_BETWEEN(target=COUCH_0, anchors={TABLE_1, TABLE_2})

# color of the tables is beige
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TABLE_1, condition="beige")
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TABLE_2, condition="beige")

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(COUCH_0)

program:

SET_TARGET(DESK_0)

text: looking directly at the white board choose the desk that is on the opposite wall as the clock and if the white board is the front of the room then its the last desk on the right and right closest to you.
program:
# define variables for the whiteboard, desk, and clock
WHITEBOARD_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["whiteboard"])
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])
CLOCK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["clock"])
WALL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["wall"])

# Find the desk on the opposite wall as the clock.  This is the primary constraint.
CONSTRAINT_OPPOSITE(target=DESK_0, anchor=CLOCK_0)

# Since the desk and the clock are on the opposite wall from the whiteboard, they should be on some wall.
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CLOCK_0, anchor=WALL_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=DESK_0, anchor=WALL_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=WHITEBOARD_0, anchor=WALL_0)

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(DESK_0)

text: you are looking for one of four chairs. 3 chairs are along one of the longer walls, with one chair along one of the shorter walls. this chair in front of the short wall is the one you are looking for. it is light gray, facing a door and a paper recycling bin, with a teal chair next to it.
program:
# Define variables for the chairs, door, and recycling bin
CHAIR_TARGET = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
CHAIR_TEAL = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])
RECYCLING_BIN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["recycling bin"])

# The target chair is light gray
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_TARGET, condition="lightgrey")

# The target chair faces a door and a paper recycling bin. Convert "facing" into "opposite"
CONSTRAINT_OPPOSITE(target=CHAIR_TARGET, anchor=DOOR_0)
CONSTRAINT_OPPOSITE(target=CHAIR_TARGET, anchor=RECYCLING_BIN_0)

# A teal chair is next to the target chair
CONSTRAINT_BESIDE(target=CHAIR_TARGET, anchor=CHAIR_TEAL)
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_TEAL, condition="teal")

# Since we only have relative relationships to the target, let's try and ground the target chair by maximizing its distance to the room center.
ROOM_CENTER = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])
CONSTRAINT_FAR(target=CHAIR_TARGET, anchor=ROOM_CENTER)

# Set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_TARGET)

# 1. larger one in the middle of the room

CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=TABLE_WOODEN, anchor=ROOM_CENTER)

# the table with the white top is in the middle of the room
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=TABLE_WHITE, anchor=ROOM_CENTER)

ARMCHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["armchair", "chair", "couch"])
BOOKSHELF_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["bookshelf", "shelf"])

# add a constraint: the armchair is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=ARMCHAIR_0, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: the armchair is in front of the bookshelf
CONSTRAINT_FRONT(target=ARMCHAIR_0, anchor=BOOKSHELF_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(ARMCHAIR_0)

text: pretend that you are standing in front of the couch and looking at the door with the long shawl hanging off of it.  now, look to the left of the door.  the keyboard is on the desk, right in front of the greenish/gray office chair that is slightly pulled out.  there is no human in this chair.
program:
# define variables for the objects mentioned in the query
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])
KEYBOARD_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["keyboard"])
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
PERSON_NEG_0 = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["person"])

# the query states "standing in front of the couch and looking at the door", implying the door is in front of the couch. This information is not relevant to grounding the keyboard and the chair.
# similarly, the fact that the door has a "long shawl hanging off of it" does not contribute to grounding the keyboard and the chair

# query also states "look to the left of the door". This relation matters.
CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=DESK_0, anchor=DOOR_0)

# "the keyboard is on the desk"
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=KEYBOARD_0, anchor=DESK_0)

# "right in front of the greenish/gray office chair" means the keyboard and chair are facing each other. Since we are looking at the keyboard (implied), the chair is behind it. Also, chair is near the keyboard.
CONSTRAINT_BEHIND(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=KEYBOARD_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=KEYBOARD_0)

# "greenish/gray office chair" - we convert greenish/gray to gray.
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="gray")

# "that is slightly pulled out"
# "there is no human in this chair". This means we need to use a negative variable for person.
CONSTRAINT_IN(target=PERSON_NEG_0, anchor=CHAIR_0)

# set the target object as CHAIR_0
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: of the two file cabinets furthest from the white board, this is the smaller one.
program:
# define variables for the file cabinets and whiteboard
FILE_CABINET_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["file cabinet"])
FILE_CABINET_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["file cabinet"])
WHITEBOARD_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["whiteboard", "board"])

# add constraints: two file cabinets farthest from the whiteboard
CONSTRAINT_MORE(target=FILE_CABINET_0, reference=FILE_CABINET_1, anchor=WHITEBOARD_0, score_func="distance")

# add constraint: this is the smaller one (i.e. FILE_CABINET_1 is the smaller one)
CONSTRAINT_LESS(target=FILE_CABINET_1, reference=FILE_CABINET_0, score_func="size")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(FILE_CABINET_1)

text: if you are facing the two doors this is the door on the right. it is closest to the bedside table with a red lamp.
program:
# The error occurs because CONSTRAINT_RIGHT requires two different objects. The original query specifies the door "on the right" when facing two doors. Since the other door is not explicitly mentioned as a relevant object, I can not represent that relationship correctly using the objects available.
# So I will remove the "right" constraint, and only keep the constraint with the nightstand.
# define the door variable, which is the target
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])

# define the bedside table variable
NIGHTSTAND_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["nightstand"])

# add a constraint: the door is closest to the bedside table
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=DOOR_0, anchor=NIGHTSTAND_0, score_func="distance")

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(DOOR_0)

CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair", "office chair"])
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])

# add a constraint: the chair is near the desk
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=DESK_0)

# add a constraint: the chair is green
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="green")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: facing the wall with the white board it is the chair to the left closest to the white wall

text: the are 2 small trashcans in between two doors very close to each other. if you are facing those doors it's the trashcan that it on the right (not the blue one).
program:
# define variables for the trash cans and doors
TRASH_CAN_RIGHT = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can"])
TRASH_CAN_LEFT = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can"])
DOOR_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])
DOOR_2 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])

# add a constraint: the two doors are close to each other
CONSTRAINT_CLOSE(target=DOOR_1, anchor=DOOR_2)

# the trash cans are in between the doors
CONSTRAINT_BETWEEN(target=TRASH_CAN_RIGHT, anchors={DOOR_1, DOOR_2})
CONSTRAINT_BETWEEN(target=TRASH_CAN_LEFT, anchors={DOOR_1, DOOR_2})

# the target trash can is smaller than the other one
CONSTRAINT_LESS(target=TRASH_CAN_RIGHT, reference=TRASH_CAN_LEFT, score_func="size")

# the target trash can is not the blue one
TRASH_CAN_BLUE = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can"])
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TRASH_CAN_BLUE, condition="blue")

# finally, set the target
SET_TARGET(TRASH_CAN_RIGHT)

# Replace "bookcase" with the available similar object labels.
# Use "bookshelf" and "book rack" to replace "bookcase".
# "the end of the row of bookcases": Since we are given the 'book rack' and 'bookshelf' labels, we assume they are already the row of bookcases.
# The target is "the small bookcase", so it is the "MIN_OF" one.
# "on the darkest part of the carpet" means, closest to the darkest part of the carpet, which can be interpreted as being on the darkest part of the floor.

BOOKSHELF_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["bookshelf", "book rack"])
FLOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["floor"])

CONSTRAINT_ON(target=BOOKSHELF_0, anchor=FLOOR_0)

# Find the smallest bookcase in the row.
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=BOOKSHELF_0, score_func="size")

# Set the target variable.
SET_TARGET(BOOKSHELF_0)

CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
TRASH_CAN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can"])

# add a constraint: the trash can is blue
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TRASH_CAN_0, condition="blue")

# add a constraint: the chair is the closest to the blue trash can
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TRASH_CAN_0, score_func="distance")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: white board on the right when facing them, nearest to the door
program:
# define variables for the whiteboard and the door
WHITEBOARD_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["whiteboard"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])

# add a constraint: the whiteboard is white
# It is already specified in the label

# add a constraint: the whiteboard is on the right of a reference point (the person facing them) and nearest to the door. The right relation can be converted to far from the left.
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=WHITEBOARD_0, anchor=DOOR_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(WHITEBOARD_0)

BATHROOM_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["bathtub", "toilet", "sink"])

text: first go to the desk that is on the same side as a small dark sofa. if you were sitting at the desk you need to find the monitor on the far right side.
program:
# the error occurs because the score function "right" does not require an anchor

# define variables for the desk, sofa and monitor
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])
SOFA_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])
MONITOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["monitor"])

# add a constraint: the desk is on the same side as the sofa, so they are near
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=DESK_0, anchor=SOFA_0)

# add a constraint: the sofa is dark
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=SOFA_0, condition="black")

# add a constraint: the sofa is small
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=SOFA_0, score_func="size")

# add a constraint: the monitor is on the far right side, which means maximizing the "right" score_func
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=MONITOR_0, score_func="right")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(MONITOR_0)

text: the largest, tallest cabinet beside the brown door and the couch with orange and yellow pillows.
program:
# define variables for the cabinet, the brown door and the couch
CABINET_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["cabinet"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])

# add a constraint: the door is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=DOOR_0, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: the cabinet is beside the brown door and the couch
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CABINET_0, anchor=DOOR_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CABINET_0, anchor=COUCH_0)

# the cabinet is largest and tallest
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=CABINET_0, score_func="size")
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=CABINET_0, score_func="size-z")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CABINET_0)

text: it's the chair with red and white stripes.
program:
# define variables for the chair and window
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# An object cannot satisfy multiple color(red, white) constraints. It is considered a contradiction and will not be used.

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: shoes on the floor in front of the three drawers toward the left side but still in front of the white three drawers. the three drawers is to the right of the stairs if you are looking at the stairs.
program:
# define variables for shoes and floor
SHOES_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["shoes"])
FLOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["floor"])

# there are three drawers
THREE_DRAWERS = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["cabinet", "box"]) # Assuming cabinet or box is the 3 drawers.
STAIRS = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["staircase"]) # stairs

# shoes on the floor
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=SHOES_0, anchor=FLOOR_0)

# shoes in front of the drawers
CONSTRAINT_FRONT(target=SHOES_0, anchor=THREE_DRAWERS)

# drawers on the left side of the room, so away from the room center
ROOM_CENTER = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])
CONSTRAINT_AWAY(target=THREE_DRAWERS, anchor=ROOM_CENTER)

# drawers on the right of the stairs
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=THREE_DRAWERS, anchor=STAIRS)

# set the target
SET_TARGET(SHOES_0)

text: the stool closest to the blue and yellow wall art
program:
# define variables for the stool
STOOL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["stool", "chair"]) # Combining stool and chair labels as stools can be represented as chairs in some datasets.

# define a variable for the wall art. The wall art is specified as blue and yellow.
PICTURE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["picture"])

# Find the stool closest to the blue and yellow picture
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=STOOL_0, anchor=PICTURE_0, score_func="distance")

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(STOOL_0)

DESK_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])

# constraint: the fridge is white
#CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=FRIDGE_0, condition="white") # The query specifies that the fridge is *small* and *white*. Since it has two properties, we should not add this constraint.

text: you need to select the small white cabinet that is on the floor in the middle of the room directly opposite the door.

text: i am the larger storage bin without the yellow thing on top
program:
# define variables for the storage bin
STORAGE_BIN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["storage bin"])

# define negative variable to express the absence of a yellow thing on top of the storage bin
YELLOW_THING_NEG = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["bed", "blinds", "book", "books", "closet doors", "dollhouse", "door", "dresser", "floor", "lamp", "mattress", "mirror", "nightstand", "picture", "pillow", "room center", "room corner", "rope", "storage bin", "tissue box", "trash can", "tv", "wall", "window"])

# the storage bin should be larger
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=STORAGE_BIN_0, score_func="size")

# constraint: no yellow thing on the storage bin
# Since we don't know exactly what the "yellow thing" is, we simply assume that any of the RELEVANT OBJECT LABELS that is on top of the storage bin should not be "yellow".
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=YELLOW_THING_NEG, anchor=STORAGE_BIN_0)

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(STORAGE_BIN_0)

# define variables for the door, the trash can, and the two tables.
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])
TRASH_CAN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])
TABLE_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: the trash can is grey
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TRASH_CAN_0, condition="grey")

# add a constraint: the door is between the trash can and two folding tables
CONSTRAINT_BETWEEN(target=DOOR_0, anchors={TRASH_CAN_0, TABLE_0, TABLE_1})

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(DOOR_0)

CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=SHELF_0, anchor=SIGN_NEG_0)

SET_TARGET(SHELF_0)

text: the black paper towel dispenser above the white dispenser and to the right of 2 white sinks.
program:
# define variables for the objects
PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_BLACK = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["paper towel dispenser"])
PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_WHITE = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["paper towel dispenser"])
SINK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["sink"])
SINK_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["sink"])

# constraint for paper towel dispenser color
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_BLACK, condition="black")
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_WHITE, condition="white")

# the black paper towel dispenser above the white dispenser
CONSTRAINT_ABOVE(target=PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_BLACK, anchor=PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_WHITE)

# the black paper towel dispenser to the right of two white sinks
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_BLACK, anchor=SINK_0)
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_BLACK, anchor=SINK_1)

CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=SINK_0, condition="white")
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=SINK_1, condition="white")

# since SINK_0 and SINK_1 are sinks, we can also describe the target dispenser to the right of them as between the two sinks
CONSTRAINT_BESIDE(target=SINK_0, anchor=SINK_1)

# set the target
SET_TARGET(PAPER_TOWEL_DISPENSER_BLACK)

# this means that we are looking for a chair close to both the wall and window. We can select the chair by looking for the minimal distance to the average position of the wall and window

CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_1, anchor=WALL_0)

BENCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["bench", "box", "couch", "end table", "floor", "ottoman", "room center", "room corner", "table", "wall", "whiteboard"])

# the target is bench
SET_TARGET(BENCH_0)

text: the dark, short set of shelves in the room, not the bathroom
program:
# define variables for the shelves, we use all available shelf labels.
SHELF_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["shelf"])

# define a negative variable for bathroom objects
BATHROOM_NEG = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["bathroom vanity", "bathtub", "toilet"])

# The shelves should be short, i.e. with smallest height
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=SHELF_0, score_func="size-z")

# The shelves should be dark, so we should use a color constraint. Let's use darkgray
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=SHELF_0, condition="darkgray")

# Add the negative constraint. The shelves are not in the bathroom, therefore far from the bathroom.
CONSTRAINT_AWAY(target=SHELF_0, anchor=BATHROOM_NEG)

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(SHELF_0)

text: this cup is not against the brown side of the cabinet.
program:
# The query specifies that the cup is not against the brown side of the cabinet.
# This means that the cup is not on the brown side of the cabinet.

# define variables for the cup and the cabinet
CUP_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["cup"])

# define a negative variable for the cabinet
CABINET_NEG_0 = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["cabinet", "kitchen cabinets"])

# add a constraint: the cup is near the cabinet
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CUP_0, anchor=CABINET_NEG_0)

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CUP_0)

text: the cart is the one with a white top.
program:
# define the cart variable, which is the target
CART_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["cart"])

# White top is not a constraint we can directly apply. Hence, we will skip using any color constraints.

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CART_0)

DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])

text: the white table with nothing on it.

# add a constraint: the table is white

# define a negative variable to express that the table has nothing on it
OBJECT_NEG = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["boxes", "door", "doorframe", "doors", "floor", "ladder", "ledge", "rack", "recycling bin", "room center", "room corner", "sink", "traffic cone", "trash can", "vacuum cleaner", "wall"])

# first create a normal constraint: something is on the table

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(TABLE_0)

text: choose the brown chair pushed in by the circle table.
program:
# define variables for the chair and table
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair", "armchair"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: the chair is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: the chair is pushed in by the table. "pushed in" means inside.
CONSTRAINT_INSIDE(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# the table is circle. Since no information about shape can be added as constraints, we ignore this information.

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

# The cabinet is to the left of the stove
CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=CABINET_0, anchor=STOVE_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object

text: standing at the door, you want the closest keyboard to the yellow shelves on the long desk
program:
# define variables for the keyboard, shelves, and desk

SHELF_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["shelf", "cabinet"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: the shelves are yellow

# add a constraint: the keyboard is near the shelves
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=KEYBOARD_0, anchor=SHELF_0)

# add a constraint: the desk is long (largest table)
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=TABLE_0, score_func="size")

# add a constraint: the shelves are on the desk
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=SHELF_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# add a constraint: the keyboard is the closest to the yellow shelves

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(KEYBOARD_0)

text: if facing this white board the chairs at the table will be in this order from left to right. the one on the left will be pushed in and the other two chairs will be pushed out close to the white board.
program:
# define variables for the objects
WHITEBOARD_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["whiteboard"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])
CHAIR_LEFT = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
CHAIR_MIDDLE = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
CHAIR_RIGHT = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# assume that the chairs are at the table
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_LEFT, anchor=TABLE_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_MIDDLE, anchor=TABLE_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_RIGHT, anchor=TABLE_0)

# assume that the table is near the whiteboard
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=TABLE_0, anchor=WHITEBOARD_0)

# chairs at the table will be in this order from left to right: CHAIR_LEFT, CHAIR_MIDDLE, CHAIR_RIGHT
CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=CHAIR_MIDDLE, anchor=CHAIR_LEFT)
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=CHAIR_MIDDLE, anchor=CHAIR_RIGHT)

# the one on the left will be pushed in and the other two chairs will be pushed out close to the white board.
CONSTRAINT_AWAY(target=CHAIR_LEFT, anchor=WHITEBOARD_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_MIDDLE, anchor=WHITEBOARD_0)
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_RIGHT, anchor=WHITEBOARD_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object. Since there is no unique target, we choose the leftmost chair.
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_LEFT)

text: when standing in the middle of the room facing the carts, the correct one is on the left. it is next to the bin with the blue lid.
program:

RECYCLING_BIN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["recycling bin"])
ROOM_CENTER_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])

# the query mentions the cart is on the left of some other object when standing in the middle of the room facing the carts
# since the facing direction is carts, the reference must be a cart. let us denote that cart as CART_REF

CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=CART_0, anchor=CART_REF)

# the cart is next to the bin with the blue lid, but we don't care about the lid color. We will simplify it as "near"

# finally set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CART_0)

program:
# define variables for the book and table
BOOK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["book", "books"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: the book is white
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=BOOK_0, condition="white")

# add a constraint: the book is on the table
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=BOOK_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(BOOK_0)

text: the white monitor furthest from the trash cans which are in between the two doors
program:
# define variables for the monitor, trash cans and doors
MONITOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["monitor"])
TRASH_CAN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door", "doorframe"])
DOOR_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door", "doorframe"])

# add a constraint: the monitor is white
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=MONITOR_0, condition="white")

# add a constraint: trash cans are between the two doors

# add a constraint: monitor is furthest from trash can
CONSTRAINT_FAR(target=MONITOR_0, anchor=TRASH_CAN_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(MONITOR_0)

text: the brighter chair; the sofa chair with more light shining on it
program:
# define variables for the sofa chair
SOFA_CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["sofa chair"])

# The "sofa chair with more light shining on it" implies the brighter chair, 
# so we should find the sofa chair with the largest "light" value.
# However, since we do not have "light" value available, we are going to use the "distance" to the "room corner", assuming it's the corner with windows that provides the light.

ROOM_CORNER_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room corner"])

#Constraint: we find the sofa chair nearest to room corner
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=SOFA_CHAIR_0, score_func="distance", anchor=ROOM_CORNER_0)

# set the target as the brighter chair (sofa chair with more light shining on it)
SET_TARGET(SOFA_CHAIR_0)

text: the blue and white floral chair against the wall, beside the low light brown bookshelf.

BOOKSHELF_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["bookshelf"])

# Color constrains cannot be applied because the chair is floral, and the colors are specific to the floral pattern, not the entire object. 
# The bookshelf color "low light brown" also cannot be applied because it's too specific and not a valid CSS4 color.

# add a constraint: the chair is against the wall
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=WALL_0)

# add a constraint: the chair is beside the bookshelf
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=BOOKSHELF_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

program:
# since the query specifies "group of 3 trash cans", this implies there are at least 3 trash cans,
# and we need to locate a "round and grayish" one

# define a variable for the target trash can
TRASH_CAN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can", "recycling bin"])

# Since the round and grayish properties apply to the trash can itself, not only part of it, these can be used as constraints.
# However, there is no constraint available to describe the shape "round". Therefore, we only consider the color.
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TRASH_CAN_0, condition="gray")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(TRASH_CAN_0)

text: the white pillow on the chair by the window
program:
# define variables for the pillow, chair and window
PILLOW_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["pillow"])
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["armchair", "couch"]) # Using couch and armchair here, since chair is not in the list.
WINDOW_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["window"])

# add a constraint: the pillow is white
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=PILLOW_0, condition="white")

# add a constraint: the pillow is on the chair
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=PILLOW_0, anchor=CHAIR_0)

# add a constraint: the chair is by the window
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=WINDOW_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(PILLOW_0)

text: the white box with a small brown box on top of it.
program:
# define variables for the white box and the small brown box
BOX_WHITE = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["box"])
BOX_BROWN = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["box"])

# add a constraint: the white box has a color white
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=BOX_WHITE, condition="white")

# add a constraint: the brown box has a color brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=BOX_BROWN, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: the small brown box is on top of the white box
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=BOX_BROWN, anchor=BOX_WHITE)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(BOX_WHITE)

text: the slim black tower right next to the right of the other slim black tower, when facing them.
program:
# There are two slim black towers, let's define them
COMPUTER_TOWER_RIGHT = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["computer tower"])
COMPUTER_TOWER_LEFT = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["computer tower"])

# The target is the tower on the right of the other
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=COMPUTER_TOWER_RIGHT, anchor=COMPUTER_TOWER_LEFT)

# It is black
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=COMPUTER_TOWER_RIGHT, condition="black")
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=COMPUTER_TOWER_LEFT, condition="black")

# They are slim, i.e. small size-x
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=COMPUTER_TOWER_RIGHT, score_func="size-x")
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=COMPUTER_TOWER_LEFT, score_func="size-x")

# Set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(COMPUTER_TOWER_RIGHT)

text: the chair directly under the tall black desk.

CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])

# add a constraint: the chair is directly under the desk
CONSTRAINT_UNDER(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=DESK_0)

# add a constraint: the desk is black
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=DESK_0, condition="black")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

# the object on top of the cabinet

SET_TARGET(KITCHEN_CABINET_0)

text: rightmost brown wooden bench in front of wall of postcards
program:
# The query includes "rightmost in front of wall", so it is related to the room center.

# define variables for the bench and wall

WALL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["wall"])

# the target bench should be brown.
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=BENCH_0, condition="brown")

# the target bench should be rightmost. That means that we should use the "right" score function to find the object that is most on the right side.
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=BENCH_0, score_func="right")

# the target bench should be in front of the wall.
CONSTRAINT_FRONT(target=BENCH_0, anchor=WALL_0)

# the target bench should be wooden. Since wood is not a color, we can not add a color constraint.

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(BENCH_0)

CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# define variable for another chair that has something blue on it
CHAIR_BLUE = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# define variable for the door
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door"])

# constraint: the target chair is across the chair that has something blue on it
CONSTRAINT_OPPOSITE(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=CHAIR_BLUE)

# constraint: the target chair is near the door
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=DOOR_0)

# constraint: there are only two chairs, therefore the target must be different from the chair_blue
# this is implicitly enforced by the CSP, and need not be explicitly written

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: books closest to the chair with the red backpack.

CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=BACKPACK_0, anchor=CHAIR_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(BOOK_0)

text: black pillow in the corner of the couch.
program:

COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])

# define variable for the room corner
ROOM_CORNER_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room corner"])

# add a constraint: the pillow is black

# add a constraint: the pillow is in the corner of the couch

CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=PILLOW_0, anchor=ROOM_CORNER_0)

text: this two seat black couch does not have a wall of bookshelves behind it and has a burgundy pillow or something on it.
program:
# define variables for the couch and wall
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch", "armchair"]) # couch is also referred to as armchair
WALL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["wall"]) # wall will be used to denote the absence of "wall of bookshelves behind it"

# define negative variable for "wall of bookshelves behind it", can be approximated by having bookshelf on wall behind it
BOOKSHELF_NEG = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["bookshelf", "books", "book"]) # books can be referred to as book or books

# the "wall of bookshelves" shouldn't be there, thus, no books should be near it, i.e., it's a negative constraint
CONSTRAINT_BEHIND(target=WALL_0, anchor=BOOKSHELF_NEG)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(COUCH_0)

text: the second monitor at the desk closest to the dark couch with a pillow and whiteboard
program:
# since the target is the second monitor, there must be at least two monitors in total
# so we define a variable for each of them
MONITOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["monitor"])
MONITOR_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["monitor"])

# define variables for the desk, couch, pillow and whiteboard
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])
PILLOW_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["pillow"])

# the couch is dark
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=COUCH_0, condition="darkgray")

# the pillow is on the couch
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=PILLOW_0, anchor=COUCH_0)

# the desk is close to the couch and whiteboard
CONSTRAINT_CLOSE(target=DESK_0, anchor=COUCH_0)

# the monitor is on the desk
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=MONITOR_0, anchor=DESK_0)
CONSTRAINT_ON(target=MONITOR_1, anchor=DESK_0)

# constraint: the target chair (MONITOR_1) is farther from the couch than the other chair (MONITOR_0)
CONSTRAINT_MORE(target=MONITOR_1, reference=MONITOR_0, anchor=COUCH_0, score_func="distance")

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(MONITOR_1)

text: look for the table that is on top of the gray part of the carpet.

# define variables for the table
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# Since there is no "carpet" object label available, and the query specified that the table is on top of a "gray part of the carpet",

program:
# The error occurs because the target and anchor in CONSTRAINT_CENTER cannot be the same.

text: the chair that is alone under the smaller tan table.
program:
# define variable for the target chair
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# define variable for the tan table
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# define a negative variable to express that the chair is alone
CHAIR_NEG = DEFINE_NEGATIVE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# add a constraint: the chair is under the table
CONSTRAINT_UNDER(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# add a constraint: the table is tan
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TABLE_0, condition="tan")

# add a constraint: the table is smaller
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=TABLE_0, score_func="size")

# add a constraint: the chair is alone. This is implemented as follows.
# Consider all other chair objects and define a negative constraint for the chair being alone, so there must not be any nearby chairs.
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=CHAIR_NEG)

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: the single chair at the brown desk
program:
# define variables for the chair and table
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: chair at the table
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# add a constraint: table is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TABLE_0, condition="brown")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: red office chair that's facing away from desk
program:
# define variables for the red office chair
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# define variables for the desk
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# color of office chair is red
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="red")

# add a constraint: the chair is facing away from desk
CONSTRAINT_AWAY(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: the chair is next to the desk that is closest to the blue trashcan.
program:
# define the variables
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table", "coffee table"])
TRASH_CAN_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["trash can"])

# the target chair is next to the desk
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# the desk is the closest to the blue trashcan
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=TABLE_0, anchor=TRASH_CAN_0, score_func="distance")

# there must be a blue trash can
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TRASH_CAN_0, condition="blue")

# set the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: the black chair closest to the computer monitor
program:
# define variables for the black chair and the computer monitor
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
MONITOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["monitor"])

# add a constraint: the chair is black
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="black")

# add a constraint: the chair is the closest one to the computer monitor
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=CHAIR_0, score_func="distance", anchor=MONITOR_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

program:

text: black chair closest to the couch
program:
# define variables for the chair and couch
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
COUCH_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["couch"])

# add a constraint: the chair is black
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="black")

# add a constraint: the chair is closest to the couch
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=COUCH_0, score_func="distance")

text: blue armed chair closer to the tall bookshelf.
program:
# define variables for the chair and bookshelf
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair", "couch"]) # armed chair is similar to a couch
BOOKSHELF_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["bookshelf", "shelf"])

# add a constraint: the chair is blue
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="blue")

# add a constraint: the bookshelf is tall
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=BOOKSHELF_0, score_func="size-z")

# add a constraint: the chair is closer to the bookshelf
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=BOOKSHELF_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)
